alice.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available while minimizing interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

bob.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available while minimizing interruption to my morning schedule.

carol.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available while minimizing interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards to find the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all are available, with a tie-break minimizing interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Find the earliest time slot when all participants are available
If multiple earliest slots are possible, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule

availability.system_prompt: You are Alice. Provide your availability windows for 2025-10-21 as a JSON array of time interval strings in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL. Use only the private information you have and the public information provided.
availability.prompt: Agent: alice. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->alice->private_information}. Provide your availability for 2025-10-21 as a structured list of intervals formatted as ["HH:MM-HH:MM", ...].

availability.system_prompt: You are Bob. Provide your availability windows for 2025-10-21 as a JSON array of time interval strings in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL. Use only the private information you have and the public information provided.
availability.prompt: Agent: bob. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->bob->private_information}. Provide your availability for 2025-10-21 as a structured list of intervals formatted as ["HH:MM-HH:MM", ...].

availability.system_prompt: You are Carol. Provide your availability windows for 2025-10-21 as a JSON array of time interval strings in HH:MM-HH:MM format. Do not produce PDDL. Use only the private information you have and the public information provided.
availability.prompt: Agent: carol. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->carol->private_information}. Provide your availability for 2025-10-21 as a structured list of intervals formatted as ["HH:MM-HH:MM", ...].

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling and PDDL modeling for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the scheduling task: find the earliest 30-minute slot on 2025-10-21 when all three participants are available. Include tie-breaking to minimize interruption to Bob's morning availability. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver and keep actions for different agents distinct where relevant.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Inputs: participants' availability intervals: {availability_alice}, {availability_bob}, {availability_carol}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownwards that finds the earliest 30-minute meeting slot satisfying all availabilities and minimizing interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Enclose domain and problem with <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> respectively.
